pageContext.claim: “Our biggest threat to this election is governors from opposing parties controlling ballots, millions of ballots. To me, that's a much bigger threat than foreign countries, because much of the stuff coming out about foreign countries turned out to be untrue.”
pageContext.analysis: Governors don't "control" ballots and no wide-scale fraud or election-rigging was found in 2020. In every voting jurisdiction, bipartisan teams of state and local election officials are in charge of verifying and counting ballots.
